result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taiwanna L Sanders

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taiwanna L Sanders appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Court appoints Christin Saint Pierre as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Saint Pierre accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, upon completion of representation until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON10-16-2022 IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Taiwanna L Sanders in court. Student Intern Madeline Witte under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/14/22 @ 1:30p
